control.name: Upload
control.helpHtml: A button that lets the user select a file from their computer.

property.name: Name
property.helpHtml: Name that can be given to the control. Names are used to help identify controls uniquely.

property.name: Form summary label
property.helpHtml: Summary label to appear at the end of the form. Leave blank to have the control and its value hidden.

property.name: Message
property.helpHtml: An alternative message that can be displayed - the default is "Drop files here to upload".

property.name: Cancel message
property.helpHtml: An alternative message that can be displayed for the cancel link instead of the default "Cancel upload"

property.name: Remove message
property.helpHtml: An alternative message that can be displayed for the remove link instead of the default "Remove file"

property.name: Accepted files
property.helpHtml: A comma separated list of mime types or file extensions. Eg.: image/*,application/pdf,.psd - by default Rapid accpets .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .png, .pdf

property.name: Max files
property.helpHtml: Maximum number of files allowed to be uploaded.

property.name: Max file size
property.helpHtml: Maximum allowed file size in megabytes.

property.name: Resize width
property.helpHtml: If set, images will be resized to this width in pixels before being uploaded. If resizeHeight is not provided, the original aspect ratio of the file will be preserved.

property.name: Resize height
property.helpHtml: If set, images will be resized to this height in pixels before being uploaded. If resizeWidth is not provided, the original aspect ratio of the file will be preserved.

property.name: Resize quality
property.helpHtml: The quality of the resized images - a number between 0 and 100

property.name: Resize method
property.helpHtml: How the images should be scaled down in case both resizeWidth and resizeHeight are provided.
